title: Xiangqi Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic Xiangqi (Chinese Chess) rules and concepts.

questions.text: Which piece in Xiangqi must jump over exactly one piece to capture?
questions.explanation: The Cannon moves like a Chariot (Rook) but must jump over exactly one piece to capture.

questions.text: The Elephant in Xiangqi can cross the river.
questions.explanation: The Elephant cannot cross the river, which limits its movement to its own side of the board.

questions.text: How many total intersection points are on a standard Xiangqi board?
questions.explanation: A Xiangqi board has 9 files and 10 ranks, making 9×10 = 90 intersection points.

questions.text: In Xiangqi, the Generals can face each other directly on the same file if there are no pieces between them.
questions.explanation: This is the 'flying general' rule. The two Generals cannot face each other directly on the same file with no pieces between them.

questions.text: What happens to a Soldier in Xiangqi when it crosses the river?
questions.explanation: After crossing the river, a Soldier gains the ability to move horizontally in addition to moving forward.
